dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I finally visited the pet store and bought nice harnesses for all my pets.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's good, I'm glad you got that sorted. It will be good for them. Remind me what pets you have.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I have 2 dogs and a cat.  So now they're all ready to go for a walk.  Surprisingly, my cat actually walks with us sometimes.  Does your cat ever go outside?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, sometimes. We have a bit of land around our house so she goes prowling. Sometimes brings us some presents back.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yuck, those cat presents are never fun.  I've gotten my fair share of those, haha!  What's your cat's name?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Phoebe. I love her to bits. How do the cat and the dogs get on?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Aww, that's a cute name.  They really do quite well together.  They're all like best buds.  They're really protective of each other though, so they're not always quick to warm up to other peoples pets.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's understandable. That shows you must be taking real good care of them for them to be comfortable together. How is your work going?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It's going.  I don't know, it's fine I guess.  It gets monotonous cleaning gutters all day, but at least I can listen to music while I work. How about you? How's your job going lately?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Same really. It pays the bills. I like the fact I get to interact with people, but it's not what I'd love to do. I'd love to be a vet.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That's awesome. Do you have any plans to go to vet school?  I have a friend who finally became a vet, but it was a long, difficult journey.  I had never known that vet school is harder to get accepted into than med school.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I wish I could but I don't know if I could devote the time. I look at the the example of my mum and think everything she devoted to her work and wonder if I could do it.

dialogue.text: How is your pit bull doing?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Thanks for asking, Bruce (my pit bull's name) is doing pretty well. He's being doing some physical therapy as his injury has made it difficult to walk, but it seems to be getting easier.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am so happy to hear that about Bruce.  Again I am so sorry about what happened to him.  How are you doing?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I'm not going to lie, it's been rough, but I'm doing a lot better now that he's able to walk again. It was so hard to see him struggle, he's normally such an active guy. I'm just thankful that my chihuahaua, Elle, wasn't injured too. How's Fifi Von Trixibelle doing?

dialogue.text: I understand that, sometimes it's hard to make time for mani pedis! Do you have any other birthday plans for Fifi Von Trixibelle?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We are going to go to the dog park and have a little party for her at home.  I got some balloons and ordered a cute little cake for dogs.  She is going to love it.  Do you do anything special for your doggies on their birthday?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh i love that! I usually make them some special birthday cookies (safe for dogs of course) and we'll go to the park that has a doggie splash pad. They both love the water, so always have a great time!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds like fun too.  It is so nice to do special things for them.  Especially when they bring so much joy to our lives.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I took a walk with Fifi Von Trixibelle and made sure she didn't damage her nails.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's funny Bruce, especially after the accident, has no issues getting his nails done, but little Elle is a real stinker with it!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: In many respects, dogs are lucky to have the symbiotic relationship they have with humans. They get free food and can live like kings.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I know right!  They definitely run my household and I bet Fifi is the same way right?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yes, she is. It is amazing that she lets me have her nails done. I wonder what her interpretation of her nails being painted is.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You do wonder what is going on in their heads.  Is she a picky eater too?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: No, definitely not. When we were on our walks earlier, she ate almost every piece of scrap food on the ground we ran across. Does Ella damage his nails when they are done?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Elle is weird.  She usually just gives me the silent treatment when we do get her nails done. Though the way to her heart is through her stomach!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My dog is so well behaved. I've been thinking about getting a second dog. How do you manage ensuring your two dogs develop a good relationship and are comfortable living together?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Bruce is so even tempered it was pretty easy, but the key is introducing your dog first.  Maybe don't pick one out until you know they appear suitable with Fifi.  Then again, most dogs figure it out it seems.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I assumed that most of them figure it out. Maybe I'll take my dog with me when I go shopping. I wonder if different nail colors will affect how friendly the reactions are that she gets from other dogs.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: LOL.  That might be an interesting experiment!

dialogue.text: I finished packing my things for my upcoming move.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm about to move to my university as well! What made you choose pre-med as your major?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I always had interested in biology and my favorite uncle is a doctor. Moreover, it's a noble profession and I hope I can save some lives.

dialogue.text: Have you given any more thought on pre-med as a major? I could share my course list with you!

dialogue.text: I've thought about it! Why did you decide to go into pre-med and become a doctor?

dialogue.text: I did some quick research about Japan, sounds like an amazing place!

dialogue.text: Well I must admit that embracing who you are is something to be admired. I think that most really good musicians and singers historically have been rather eccentric though. Maybe it goes with the territory.

dialogue.text: I agree with you on this. You are right. Listen, it's a while that I feel my throat burning...what was that cure that you were talking about earlier?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: The cure for the cold? I personally feel that Thieves essential oil with Lemon in hot tea does wonders for a burning throat. And some good old fashioned rest as well! You have to listen to your body. It's particularly important if you're a singer. You can really damage your vocal cords if you don't take care of yourself when you're sick.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I will go to buy some essential oil as soon as possible then. Can't wait to go back home and enjoy something warm. A lemon tea sounds great! I will follow your advice. Thanks!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: You're welcome! I hope you feel better soon. Take good care of yourself!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I will let you know how it goes. Maybe we can catch up tomorrow. Do you have any plan for tomorrow?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My nephew wants to learn violin as well. Do you happen to know any good teachers or places to learn?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I would love to be able to help. When I first started, I picked it up myself. There are some good YouTube videos that might help him get started.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: YouTube is a great resource for so many things, but we didn't think about it for violin lessons, so we'll check that out, thanks.  Do you have a specific breed of dog in mind to adopt, or are you going to rescue from a shelter?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I really want to help a rescue dog in need. We have a shelter nearby that I want to go visit soon. The problem is, I will probably want to take them all home with me! How has your weight lifting been going?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm working to increase my maximum lifts, but I think there is not too much more room for improvement without steroids.  I know what you mean about wanting to take all of the shelter dogs home, they're all so sad and just need someone to love them.  Do you have a favorite Indian restaurant?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: We have a local Indian restaurant that delivers. I love the the Sri Lanka Garlic Curry they do. Just the right level of spice. Do you have to watch what you're eating for your weight training?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am careful with my diet, but have to eat enough to maintain all of the muscle so I eat a lot of protein.  I enjoy some spice, but I don't care for too much heat.  Is the Garlic Curry very hot?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's slightly hot. I like it because it's got enough heat to leave a tingle on your tongue without burning it off! I can't handle curries that are too hot. Our local Indian puts a lot of meat in their dishes, so you'd get your protein!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds great, I'd like to try it sometime.  We have a lot of Indian restaurants nearby, but I've been scared to try them because of not knowing what would be too hot.  So many cuisines use such great spices, I love that we have so many choices to eat out now.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah it's great. I love trying food from different cultures. I didn't like spicy food in the past but I started off mild and worked my way up. You'll have to start with a Masala or Bhuna. They are mild.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Thanks for the tip, that helps a lot - I will be able to be a little more adventurous now!  I really like trying all of the different cuisines too, and really like it when I can try different restaurants with friends who are more familiar with the food.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, and it will give you variety when your getting your protein. What kind of food is your favourite?

dialogue.text: Have you looked into the process for adopting a dog?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have started looking into it, but i haven't gotten very far in the process. I really want to do it though.

dialogue.text: No, that is part of the problem. I have to go and pick up the dog from the adoption shelter, and the closest one is about 3 hours away. I do not have a car, but i will do it one day. Have you been to the gym lately?

dialogue.text: I have a pretty nice small gym. Once I decided to get serious about the lifting, I felt it was the only option. Perhaps you could join a local facebook group and find someone to help you with transportation.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That is really cool. I wish i could lift as much as you can. Hey, that is a really good idea. I didn't even think about that, thank you for the great idea.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: No problem. Shoot, if you want I could swing by the next time I'm out your way and we'll go. I just worry I won't be able to leave without wanting to take them all.

dialogue.text: That would be so nice of you!! haha, yes, i worry about that too! Maybe we could go to an Indian restaurant before we would go? I haven't had that in a while.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Sonds like a plan. My friends just turned me on to this new place out by the airport that has some great curry.

dialogue.text: That sounds great to me! I don't get to eat it often, since i don't know a lot of people that like Indian food.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That sounds great to me! Yeah, i can't do the really spicy dishes. But i really do love Indian food, and just trying all different kind of culture's foods. It all so delicious, as long as it isn't too spicy.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Hi, my name is john. How are you?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Hi john, I am a little hot right now, how are you?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am actually cold! Do you not have a c?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I am just outside right now walking my dogs

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I don't have dogs, just horses. I do a lot of saddle riding.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I see a lot of that here in new mexico but I have never done it

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Never been to new mexico. I grew up on a cattle farm in rural kansas.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I've never been there

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: What about detroit? That's where I do law enforcement work at.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: No I've never been there. I'm from nevada, ever been there?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Never, but my three daughters really want to go.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh you are a parent?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am. Proud father of 3, my wife and I scuba when the kids are away

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's nice. I never knew my parents. Grew up in an orphanage

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to hear that. What do you do for fun?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I walk my dogs and go to pet stores to play with dogs

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: What is your dogs name?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have a female boxer named Kimo and a male lab named Todo.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: What pet stores do you go to to shop for Kimo and Todo?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Petsmart usually has everything I need.  It's probably much harder shopping for horse supplies!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I go to the Tractor Supply Store for my horse feed. Do you like to ride horses?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I love horses!  My parents live in the country and have horses.  I would always take Kimo and Todo out there because they were very close to the horses and loved to play together.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How sweet! Horses are the best. We should ride in Nevada. I will come visit since I have never been there!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That would be great!  Nevada has so much to see.  Not many places to scuba dive but I'm sure there are so many fun things to do here.  I can tell you all the good pet stores to browse lol

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Great! Can I bring my daughters? I think they would enjoy it too.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Absolutely!  I might go up with you from New Mexico and bring Kimo and Todo.  I think you're girls would love to play with them.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: They would! My wife will be happy to have the weekend to herself too.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Nevada is such a relaxing place.  Kimo and Todo will spend most of the day laying around on the porch if I let them.  Who will take care of your horses while you are gone?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Me and the wife finally took a trip to new mexico for some riding and we enjoyed it a lot

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: How wonderful but if only you had let me know. I could have hosted you for part of your stay. It would have been so good to see you and your wife.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How kind of you to offer! I'll make sure to let you know next time I'm in the area. What have you been up to since the last time we chatted?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I went diving at the weekend at Blue Hole in Santa Rosa. It's been a little while and I forgot how much I loved it. I meant to ask how did you find the food and the people in Mexico?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We love Mexican food, so we found a lot of tasty restaurants. The guys at the horse stable were very friendly. We didn't talk much to the locals. Where's your favorite place to eat in New Mexico?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I like the Artichoke cafe fish, pork chops it's classic Mexican cuisine and contemporary American

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds delicious. I'll have to try that next time I'm in the area. Did you take your dogs with you when you went on your scuba diving trip?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: No, they are getting old. Sydney has had some investigative surgery so I'm just waiting on results. My sisters looked after them while I went off for the day.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear about Sydney! I hope you get good results. How old are your dogs, and what breeds?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: 10 and 11. Both are labradors and they generally live 10-12 years but they have been well looked after and loved very much. If Sydney gets over whatever this is, hopefully nothing too serious I hope to have both Sydney and Josie with me for a few years yet. And how are your horses? Riding in Mexico, riding on the farm, you must be saddle sore!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We had a wonderful time, and I think my horses enjoyed themselves, too. The change in environment seemed to give them a lot of energy. We are a bit sore, though, but it feels good, like the feeling after a great workout.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have never ridden. Horses scare me but I hope to try riding at some point. Perhaps when you come to New Mexico again you can show me the basics. It will be just another reason to meet you friend.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Why do you prefer summer over winter? I love the cooler weather.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I love going to the beach! It's one of my happy places. Nothing like sitting in the sand, music playing, beer in my hand, and looking at the ocean!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Mmmmm that does sound so good. I bet you are hating it at the moment with this cold snap happening! Thank god I dont live in texas, my friends toilet froze today.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I've lived in Maryland my whole life so I'm used to both cold and heat! Right now it's snowing outside. I have friends in Texas. luckily they have been able to keep warm! Do how's it going with trying to quit smoking?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: So bad... I litreally cannot stop. I go for like 2 hours without a cig and I want to kill some one. Im thinking of taking a look at them tablets that change the brain so you dont smoke but Ive heard they can make you go a bit strange haha. Have you ever smoked?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Well, I hope you're able to quit eventually if you want to. I've heard it's very hard. My mother in law has been trying to quit forever. I've never smoked cigarettes, but I smoke cigars occasionally.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It is so hard, probably the hardest addiction I have ever tried to kick. Even the thought of dieing doesnt put you off... they should have made it illegal when they found it instead of using it as a tax cash out. Strange though, I smoke but never tried a cigar. You dont inhale them do you.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: No,  you shouldn't inhale cigars. The smoke is very thick. I certainly don't inhale them. I can understand the addictive part. That can be rough. I've been trying to eat healthier forever but it seems like I have an addiction to bad foods.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I remember you telling me that you love pizza, to be honest though, Id rather have a addiction to junk food than cigs and cigars haha! Talking about pizza's have you ever tried chillis on them? I had one last night.... AMAZING.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Pizza I could eat every day! I  might get one delivered for lunch actually. I've had jalapenos on pizza before. Pretty good. I always put crushed red pepper on pizza...that's delicioius!!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Mmmm, your making me hungry now. I dont think it was jalapenos as they tasted way hotter and they were red. Maybe I should just swap my addictions for food instead and just get bigger haha.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Lol...die from cancer or die from obesity...great choices!!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I have managed to go a whole day with out smoking.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Hey, that's great - well done you! How are you feeling for it?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Hmm a little bit frustrated and nervous but at least I am making some progress. What do you study?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Just finished up on dentistry, so I'm trying to find a job in that field. If you ever need teeth whitening to counter the coffee and cigarettes, I can do you a deal!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Thank you very much, that would be great! I guess you could also give me advice on healthy food ha ha

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Probably not pizza, as much as I love it! Right now, I'm really big on falafel as a health food. You ever had that?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I have never had that, is it good? I might give it a try. Where do you usually buy it, any recommendations?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's great! Very tasty - you can add spices to it and really customise the flavour. It's filling and keeps your digestion going. Falafel on pizza too is grand. You know that little health store two blocks away?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It sounds amazing when you describe it, it is making my shopping list for sure. Yes, I think I know which one but if I can't find it I will give you a call

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Most definitely! You got any trips planned this year? I know you like the cooler weather!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Actually yes, every dollar I save from not smoking is a dollar more for the trip to Alaska. My plan is to go on a cruise and just relax for a week

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh wow, that sounds amazing! I've heard the scenery is quite something up there. Too cold for me though! Might visit my friends in Texas soon actually...

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My wife made a delicious chicken broccoli alfredo. I painted a landscape.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: What kind of landscape? I love the beach myself.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It was a green mountainside, but I am planning on going to the beach soon to paint.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: So do you you just paint landscapes? I know a guy that does court drawings.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yeah I suppose you are right, I didn't think of all the cleaning that hospitals do. Disinfectant probably isn't so great for artwork...

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: So how is your wife doing?

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.text: I've spoken with my colleagues and they'd all love Italian food!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I don't think you should have any issues catering Italian food for your party. Have you ever taken Indian food. For a change that would be good too. They are spicey too. But I understand you have to go with what the group prefers.

dialogue.text: Well were going to go with catering from your dad's restaurant.

dialogue.text: You sure can. That should not be a problem. Are you looking for something specific in vegan stuff. Vegans can be very choosy at times.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: If there is some kind of vegetable sauce that you all can make, that would be nice. As long as they aren't stuck with just a side salad, haha.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Of course we can do that, but take my word that is not going to help. I suggest you talk to them and get to know what they eat and what they don't. I do not think vegetable sauce alone is going to help.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Good idea, I'll talk with them and then see what we can do.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yes, I think that is the best way. When are you planning to have the party and where is it going to be at. Your home or some other place. You have a lot of work lined up for you.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We already have a venue and a time options. We just need to discuss food options and availability with your dad.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Thats good to hear, because that is a lot of work. Just let me know and I will ask my dad to call you up and we can go from there.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I went to a car dealership recently to look for a bigger vehicle for my growing family.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Did you find anything you liked?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: A few things, but we are going to look at another dealership before we decide. Tell me more about your religion? Should I convert?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I can't really say whether you should convert or not, that's something that you really need to decide for yourself. I can tell you that my my religion is different from most others in that there aren't a bunch of restrictions and rules. The main thing is to just be a good person. Karma is also a huge thing I believe in. How would you're husband feel about you converting? And what about the kids?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We aren't very religious. But those all sound like great things for kids to grow up learning. When did you find this faith?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's been about 5 years, I had a falling out at my previous religious institution (would rather not talk about that...), and I went on an exploration of religion. Nothing really spoke to me so I decided to just establish my own. It doesn't make sense to a lot of people, but it works for me. How are you feeling? When areyou due?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm at 6 months. Honestly its easier now that this is my fourth time. We are still deciding on names though. How did your parents choose your name?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I honestly don't know! I've never though to ask them. I'll have to d that some time. Do you know what you're having?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: two more boys! I have thought about giving them "matching names", but then I also want them to feel like they are more than twins, and i am afraid if i give them names that go together they will always feel like 1/2 a set instead of a complete person on their own.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I never even thought about it like that! That makes sense though. Tough decision. How are the other kids feeling about the new edition? Are they excited?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My son is very excited to have brothers. I think the girls are less happy that they are going to be out-numbered soon. Have you thought about having kids?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I've thought about it, but just don't know if it's right for me. I like my independence (and my convertible!) I just can't imagine giving up so much and being tied down. Maybe later in life. Did you always know you wanted a family?

dialogue.text: Have you invested in anything this week?

dialogue.text: No I've decided to take a break from the market for a while, until the time is right.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: And back to what does it look like and how big is it? What kind of board do you skate on it?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Even a day trader would be subject to loosing their money on it. It's incomprehensible like Bitcoin.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am not sure I agree on the Bitcoin either. I guess day to day it is hard to track, but over time it has mostly just gone up. I guess in the day traders mind when you view things so narrowly.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: There is no logical way to justify the valuation so I try to invest in things that are logica and predictable only.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: What do you normally like to invest in?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I like Indexes and some individual stocks really nothing out of the ordinary. But all my best efforts don't always work out so I'm really will be hesitant in the near future.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Really? Please tell me what you thought about it.

dialogue.author: bot_0

He said they didn't want to have to pay if I fell off the bike and smacked my head on the floor! But I later realized it probably wasn't a very good idea for me to try anyway.

dialogue.text: My band signed up for the talent show at my college.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Thanks for the advice! I think you are right. I do blog about math, which is fun but it is not earning me much money. I will graduate in two more years.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How's your employees been this week?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Everything has been in ship shape, we're due for inspection any day now so everybody has been in top form. I'm proud.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That's good to hear. I bet an upcoming inspection would have everyone nervous. Anything you're worried about?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: They handle it surprisingly well for such a young staff. Nerves of steel I guess. I have no particulars I'm worried about, I've got to trust the staff if I'm to continue managing them, right? Ownership gives me the right amount of leash!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm glad you have that freedom at work from ownership. Having constrictions on how to do your job is the main reason I work for myself.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I don't at all blame you. If you're ever looking to supply, I'm sure I could talk them into it, speaking of. Locally sourced food is always a plus! Sometimes I find the guidance helps but the ultimate goal is to work for myself.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That would be great. I've been thinking about expanding my selection of herbs, but I've been worried I wouldn't have enough of a demand to sell everything I grow.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have some contacts in the other restaurants around town, I could inquire. Networking is the name of the game when you're looking for demand!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Agreed. What type of restaurant do you manage? Any specific needs that I could fill?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Mine is a nice Italian restaurant. We can ALWAYS use tomatoes, veggies are always a plus as well. As for herbs just about any you can think of. I find most Italian restaurants will have the same needs.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Tomatoes are a good idea. Not sure how many I can get out of my current space I have. Maybe once the summer comes around I can expand enough to supply more than one resturant.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You'd be surprised, they grow like weeds! I can't wait to see what you harvest!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: how did your inspection go? Did your employees do as well as you thought they would? I am looking forward to coming to try your Italian restaurant soon!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It went great! I trust my employees with my life so I wasn't sweating it. How's your greenhouse?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It's pretty good! I have a ton of herbs that are propagating and I am looking forward to planting more. Do you use fresh herbs at your Italian restaurant?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I try to as much as possible. Sometimes we run out though, so we have to use dried herbs. I want to see some of your plants! Maybe one day you can have your own herb business and help supply my restaurant!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I would love that! I use a lot of my herbs in my own cooking but I would love to help restaurants with fresh herbs. Have you been looking for opportunities to work for yourself?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have. It's nice having my own business but I still have to report to other people, like the inspectors. Sometimes it gets tiring. I want to work for myself completely, like you!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It's not all it's cracked up to be! Especially if you don't have employees sharing the load. It's hard managing my time sometimes. I bet you could handle it though!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I didn't think about that. That must be tough. Having free time is one of my favorite things! Maybe I should think about it a bit more.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: You should give it some thought. Eventually I will be able to hire employees but I am not quite there yet. It's hard to start out on your own. Maybe you could start with employees to ease the burden.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's a good idea! I'll have to talk it over with them.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Good idea! How is your sister doing? Is she feeling any better?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: She's doing great thanks so much for asking!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I like to have money to spend. What is the quickest way to be as rich as you?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I inherited some money and used it to develop my company. So I would say that you should find your passion and do what you can to profit from it.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Thats good advice.  My only passion right now is helping shelter pets.  I feel so sad that people overlook them because they're not a designer breed.  When are you heading back to Paris?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I think you can definitely find a way to make a lot of money by helping animals! Going to college might be a way you can find your passion helping animals. I'm planning on taking my sister there for her birthday.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I guess a business degree isn't the worst idea in the world.  I wish I had a sibling who would take me to Paris.  So jealous.  Any special plans while you are there?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Lol just regular touristy things. We'll probably go to some cafes, shop around, and visit the Eiffel tower.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: There's nothing wrong with that.  I'd probably do the same thing....and eat a lot of cheese.  How's your hockey team doing this year?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I'll definitely put eating cheese on our to-do list while we're there. Not off to the greatest start, but I have hope they'll pull through.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I've tried watching hockey on tv but I can't get into it.  Plus, it's hard to follow the puck on the ice.  Why isn't your other sister going to Paris with you?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think hockey is one of those sports that you either love or can't get into. She's going, but she's getting there a little later than us because she couldn't get extra days off of work.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Hey, at least she's going.  I'd be thrilled to just spend 24 hours in the city.  What did you major in at college?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah we couldn't celebrate a birthday without her! I majored in computer science.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I saw a cool article about things to do while you're in Paris!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh really? What was in the article?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: An article about animal shelter, as myself has been doing many volunteering work locally.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Awesome! I've been trying to save up money to go back to Paris with my sisters. Perhaps we can get a ticket to Disneyland too. How has volunteering been?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Nice, hope to bump into you there in Paris.  As for the volunteering, I mainly help out stray dogs and cats.  Administer shots and bathe them, then prepare them for adoption in store or online.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's excellent. You are doing a great service to the community. I've been meaning to get a dog for a while. I had one when I was much younger, but she's passed away since then. Her name was Josey.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: sorry to hear about Josey, as I have many close pet companions during my volunteer work.  I don't have any siblings, therefore these animals are like my brothers and sisters, which I cared very much.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's not an issue and that makes sense. I have such a large family it's unreal: two sisters, a mum, a dad, two uncles, two aunts and a set of grandparents on either side. Oh well, at least you don't have to deal with the family drama with animals, lol!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Wow, many family members makes great team working together!  So they will throw a great birthday party for you that is coming up right?  Guess you and your sister will just do that in Paris instead.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I'm celebrating my mum's birthday in Paris, actually. My birthday is only a few weeks away, March 31st. I don't know what's happening for my own birthday. I don't think I'm going to bother doing anything to be honest! So much hassle.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Well, no matter the hassle, having someone close to you to celebrate birthday is the best thing you will ever encounter.  Great talk to you, my alarm just notified me to head for the animal shelter, so I will talk to you another time then.  Have a great and safe trip to Paris, and happy birthday in advance!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's absolutely fine and let me know if you have any dogs available! Preferably a chihuahua, I've always loved those. :)

dialogue.text: I took some great pictures! I'd love to send you some.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Have you gone hiking anywhere lately?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, I've done a little bit of ice-trekking here and there. The weather isn't always friendly down here in Antarctica!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I was thinking about you the other day when it got below zero here. I don't know how you do it!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, my research keeps me here but I hate the weather. It's pretty cold in Maine this time of year though. You're probably pretty tough to withstand that New England winter.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm tough! If you think tough is turning up the heat, wearing two pairs of socks and never going outside in the winter.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I've always wanted to visit Maine. I should come up and have a lobster roll. What is your favorite thing to cook? Do you cook any local seafood or do you just eat a lot of vegan things?

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That sounds incredible. Just don't make it too spicy. Are there any great spots for photography up there?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Of course! Would you like to take some pictures of moose and bears?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: No bears please! I was thinking more like a rocky seashore. Maybe my law firm will transfer me out of Antarctic soon and I can move closer. I think I would like your area. Maybe Boston.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We'll take a trip to Boston when you come up. It's a great day trip and only a couple hours from my house.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Do they have a zoo that you like there? I was thinking maybe June so I can thaw out. My wife and kids would like a getaway as well.

dialogue.text: What did you do in the army and what was it like?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I was in a tank division. It was very stressful but I got good experience and knowledge from there, also it strengthen my mind and body. Have you been in military?

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.text: What kind of construction work do you do?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I do a lot of planning for city buildings! It's been great to keep busy since coming home.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I bought some halibut to cook this weekend.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's a northern marine fish is it? how did you come to find it

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Indeed! I bought it from the dock off of a fisherman for $5; doesn't get fresher than that! Wish I could share with you and Dex! What do you think a good side dish would be? Perhaps i'll take some to my ex at the office.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah I love that particular fish very much I wish I would have been living nearby. Okay the dish, let me see, how are you preparing the fish?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I believe I'll give it a nice sear and add a lemon butter sauce; I figure nothing with a lemon butter sauce ever turns out less than splendid!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's just perfect just try and sear directly over a furnace and not a pan, it adds flavor. Dex would have loved that dish and maybe a side dish of grilled vegetables, how's that?.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Lol my dear this must be why you don't cook often, fire hazards and all. I do respect your determination to go to great lengths on the occasions you do cook, though! That sounds lovely. Perhaps some potatoes and ..hmm.. asparagus?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: LOL that's better lets do that you truly have a passion and talent in cooking. Won't it be weird you and your ex in the office sharing a meal?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I still like him; am hoping if the dinner is good enough it will relight the flame.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: So the halibut meal was a hit! My ex told me he loved it and missed my cooking. Maybe we still have a chance here?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Glad you enjoyed the halibut, I love it.  Maybe there is still a change with you ex, the question is, do you still have male friends? Has the situation changed at all or is it going to end up same?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I do still have a lot of male friends, and I love my friends very much. I am not willing to give them up. My ex and I have not re-visited that issue. I hope he realizes he's being silly about it.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, but that might be too much to hope for.  I was thinking about trying to do some more cooking at home.  You have any tips for me?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Well a good pan is always a great place to start, that's a must, especially for frying. Also a good grade oil. I have messed up before and gotten cheap oil and it wasted the whole dish! I was very mad.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that is great info.  My mom always had cast iron skillets. Do you know anything about them or would you recommend going a different direction?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It's always good to have at least one cast iron skillet. If you care for it properly it will last you the rest of your life! Just don't drop it on your foot ;)

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: haha yes!  Might also come in handy if the husband gets out of line...just joking of course.  I think I'll pick one up.  How did you learn to cook?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Haha thats funny. I am self taught. I just got tired of paying so much for seafood at restaurants, I wanted to learn how to make it myself to save a few bucks. Now the stuff I make is better than a chain restaurant.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! There is something to about knowing you made it yourself.  you know all the ingredients and what went into making it.  Something about that just makes it taste better!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yep! Let me know when you start cooking, I can give you some tips on how to make the halibut, I bet you'll love it so much, maybe even more than my ex did, haha.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, for sure. I wish I lived closer so that we could get together and you could show me in person.  I've found that having someone there to guide you makes a world of difference.

dialogue.text: Since you aren't good at math and enjoy Las Vegas, where are you working these days?

dialogue.text: Working? Um.  IDK. My sister pays my bills, I guess. She makes a lot of money. And I have credit cards. Why would I work?

dialogue.text: Las Vegas is an expensive city, do you go gambling often?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm mostly an outdoor person in my free time, I like to be out in nature, the southwest landscape really inspires me with it's vistas.  I want to go camping under the stars sometime soon in the desert.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds like fun, stargazing under a clear desert sky is one of my favorite things to do.  Especially when you can see the city lights in the distance.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I know. Man I take all the honeys out to this spot. We'll be riding in my Hummer, of course. Ain't no better ride. My sister pays the bills and my brother fills up the tank. I'm gonna show you a nice time, baby.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My favorite style is anything gold. Do you have a favorite style?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I just like simple styles.  What do you usually draw?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I mainly use a style of realism, opting to draw beautiful, intricate landscapes and portraits of others. I'm hoping to sell some of my drawings and paintings soon to supplement my income.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That sounds very cool!  You can use that supplemental income to buy all the pizzas and earrings you want.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Hahaha yes that is true. I can only eat so many pizzas, though, but my appetite for earrings and fashion is insatiable!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Tell me more about your cat friend please.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Thanks for asking! I love talking about my cat! Her name is Liz and she is adorable! She loves snuggling with me on the couch while we watch movies together. How is your dog, Sleuth, doing?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: He's getting old in age and not moving around so much anymore.  Did ever I tell you how he got his name?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How old is he? No, but please tell me how you got his name.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: He's 15 now.  I adopted Sleuth from the shelter when he was 10, and the shelter told me that he used to be a drug sniffing dog.  So I thought the name would fit perfectly.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Wow, so that makes him about 105 years old in human years. That's a cool background story. Do you have any other dogs or just him?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It's just him for now.  I am planning on getting a puppy soon to keep Sleuth company before he passes away as well as for me as well to keep me occupied when the inevitable happens.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How is Sleuth doing? I know you said he was getting on in years.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Surprisingly well. I keep thinking he is going to slow down, but he still loves to run and play. Hopefully he sticks around a few more years. How is your cat?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: He is doing great! I had a fun experience with him the other day when a friend came by. It is the reason I gave him his name!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's good to hear :) What is the story behind his name?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Did I ever tell you his real, full name? Because if not, the story will surely make you laugh XD

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Is Liz his full name? If not, then you haven't told me his full name. I'd love to hear it and the story.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Well, I always wanted to get a dog named 5 miles so I could tell people that I walk 5 miles daily. But when I got the kitten, I decided that he should have a great unique name. So I named him Lizard. Liz is for short, and when people come over and I call his name out, LIZARD, and he comes running, they are like what? I enjoy messing with people.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Haha! That is very creative. I would like seeing the face of your friends when you do that. have you ever used Liz to model any of your art?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I don't think anyone would want a painting of a fat lazy cat sitting in the sun lol. How is it going at the newspaper? Anything exciting to cover lately?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You never know :) The newspaper is always busy and there is always a new deadline. Sometimes it is hard to keep finding story ideas. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy it, but even when I do find something I'm interested in I never have enough time to go as deeply as I'd want to on it before we have to move on to the next thing. Have you found any work to supplement your art?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I mean. It is really too embarrassing to talk about it. I am not really happy about what I am doing for money now. What beat do you have for the paper?  I always thought it would be interesting to get to like go take photos of fires and crashes and stuff.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I mainly do human interest stories. So like if you cat learned to paint or something that would be a great story for me. Covering breaking news is exciting, but you have to be on call at all hours of the day, so you don't really ever get away. Would you ever want to be profiled as a local artist? Might be good for your business and would get me a story to write.

dialogue.text: I practiced my singing some more for my talent show appearance.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I think it's great that you got over your panic enough to sing in front of people!  What songs do you like to sing?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I heard on the news the other day that there may be some change in the for-profit education business. Some government officials are discussing tuition regulation, the article may interest you.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh! I would love to read that. Can you give me a summary of what the article mentioned?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It basically stated that high tuition is making it harder for some students to obtain a degree which could damage many industries in the future! I'm hopeful something is done, but you know how lax the government can be when it comes to that type of stuff.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You're right. They are really slow to step in when it comes to the money side of education. Tuition has really grown out of control. There is no reason we should have debt before we've even entered the workforce.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I agree completely. I don't know that it should be completely cost free, but definitely more affordable for sure. What about you, have you read anything interesting lately?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I've actually been reading a few articles about the fantasy genre. It's really interesting learning about how the genre got its start and how it's developed over the decades.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Oh absolutely! It's by far one of my most favorite genres. Have you made any progress on the fantasy novel you were working on? I am excited to read it.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I haven't written anything official yet, but I have started the outline and world building process. It's been so much fun!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I believe in you, before you know it, you'll be the next Tamora Pierce!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Aww thank you! I don't know if anyone could compare to her, but that would be such an honor.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'll be in the front row at your first book signing for sure :)

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Haha you won't even have to. If I make it that far, I'll come to you with a free copy.

dialogue.text: How are things at your grocery store? Did you ever pop in like you said you needed to?

dialogue.text: Things are going great. Thanks for asking. No, I havn't gotten the chance to pop in yet. Hopefully this week. Have you started any new writing projects since we last spoke?

Maybe start with one meatless day, then two until you work your way up. What are your thoughts on that technique? Do you think your partner would support you on your vegan journey should you start?

dialogue.text: I'm feeling inspired to write my next project about my journey to trying out veganism.

dialogue.text: I meant that I changed the color of my walls to blue. They were white before. Thanks for your condolences about my dog. Do you have a pet?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I don't have a pet currently but I had a cat when I was younger. Blue sounds good! It would really bring more color into the room. My home could really do with redecorating. I haven't changed it since I moved in years ago.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: You could change the color of your walls too. What color are they now, and what new color would you pick?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: My walls are a pale grey which is pretty unambitious! I'd like to go for something much more exciting. Maybe a bright patterned wallpaper or red. Do you dye you hair yourself or get it done professionally?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I do it myself, I like having blue hair because it matches my eyes. What color is your hair?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: My hair is brown which is my natural color. I don't know what color I would suit. I love the idea of being a blonde but i'm not sure if it would look good on me. I'm so indecisive !

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I thought about it and I'd like to help you rearrange your home, if you'd like.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It might be interesting, what have you got in mind for it?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: There are a lot of things I was thinking...  We could repaint.  Hang up some pictures.  Decorate a bit.  Rearrange your furniture to make thing flow more easily.  What do you think?  Where do you want to start?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: We would have to start upstairs to clear some room out. I'm just not sure where I would want things or what to get rid of. I like the sound of your plan we just might need to think about it as we go along.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That's a good idea!  I don't want to pressure you into anything.  Have you heard of Marie Kondo?  You can do the thing were you touch each of your items and see if they mean something to you still or if you're ready to get rid of them.  It really helps to just pick up each item and see if you want to get rid of it!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I have not heard of them, I just have so much trouble parting with some things. The concept sounds interesting but nerve-wracking!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: LOL!  Yes, it does take some time but it's supposedly helped a lot of people!  It's hard to get rid of things with memories attached to them!  We could also find a way to display some of your treasures!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Ooh I like the sound of displaying, I haven't had anything on the walls in ages. I am willing to try things out if they will really help.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Perfect!  That's like a double win!  You can clear things out and also add a bit of decoration to your walls!  Maybe we should swing by  Home Goods or Target to see what kind of displays/shelves they have.  Are you free anytime in the near furture?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure how much I will get rid of, maybe the walls will be loaded with those shelves. I will be free this weekend, I stick around home those days!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Ha ha ha!  We can make it work!  This weekend is great!  I'm the same way, I don't get out much.  This will give us a good reason to get out!  We can even get lunch if you're feeling daring!  LOL

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Where would you want to go for lunch? I don't have any favorite place. Getting out will be good though, I am actually looking forward to it!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Have you played any basketball recently?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah, we're a ways into the season now! You haven't been able to watch any ball?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I enjoy watching here and there when I have time. How is your team doing this season?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: We're middle of the pack, looking to make some moves upward as things progress. Try and catch us sometime.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I will definitely try to catch a game sometime. Do you listen to a lot of music before your games?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, gotta stay pumped up and that's the best way for sure!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I agree, I like to listen to a lot of music throughout my day. Do you have any other favorite songs that help get you pumped up beside Keep ya Head up by 2pac?

dialogue.text: Honestly a guilty pleasure for pump up is Get Ready 4 This. It just works for some reason! If you ever play, something upbeat like that is good.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I agree, it is energizing. Have you been back to North Carolina University since you left?

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am not sure how well I would do with public speaking. For you, it must helping playing in front of huge crowds.

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How was your game tonight?  Did the music get you all pumped up?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Honestly, not so good. I ended up tearing my ACL and now I'm out for the rest of the season! I've been bummed about it all day. Our team ended up winning the game though, so I have mixed emotions about it.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Oh no! Man, I'm so sorry to hear that. Isn't there anything they can do to fix it? It's only the middle of the season.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Unfortunately no. Just a bunch of rest and physical therapy. You know how much basketball means to me, I'm trying to be strong but it's hard. What's even worse is that I'm supposed to give a motivational speech tomorrow and I'm scared I'm not going to do well. What would you do if you were in my situation?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Aw man, that's tough. Can you postpone it? It doesn't really sound like the best time. Of course, you could turn it around to say that sometimes things get tough and you have to work hard and persevere and be patient. I mean, one good thing about this is you can focus more on your speaking career.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You're right, I guess I could choose either option. I feel very privileged, you know? I have a ton of money and can afford to take care of myself. It makes me feel bad for being sad about my injury. If you have free time tomorrow, I would really love if you came to the speech tomorrow for some support. We can go grab some food and drinks after, on me!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Of course. I'd be honored. Money has nothing to do with it. When something bad happens, you feel it whether you're rich or poor. I'd be happy to come over early and listen to you practice if you think that'd help. We could play some music and get you all pumped up. lol

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's so right, man you really are the best person to go to when I'm feeling down. I would love getting in some extra practice! This might sound cheesy, but I got 2pac's greatest hits on vinyl and a new record player, I've been listening to it non stop. I've been meaning to show you!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Let's do it! I've never heard 2pac on vinyl. I bet it sounds so much better than digital. What time should I come over?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It really does, it sounds way smoother and more authentic. If that makes sense? If you're able to swing by after my doctor's appointment around 10am that would be great. We don't have to be there until 2:30, so it'll give us a good amount of time for practice. My maid will be over as well so she can whip us up a really good breakfast. Do you have any requests? She can cook just about anything!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds great. I'm so jealous you have a maid. What about French Toast. My mom makes terrible French Toast, but I love it. You want me to bring anything with me?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That's my favorite! She makes killer French Toast, with a little powdered sugar and strawberries too. No need to bring anything besides a water bottle in case you get thirsty later on at the event. I'll take care of the rest. Thank you so much again man, I really appreciate it.

dialogue.text: Did you find that your travels inspired your paintings?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yes they did. When I went to Spain I was inspired by the culture so I started painting with more green and red colors and the people there were very friendly.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.text: Do you have a favorite country or city that you have visited so far?

dialogue.text: I have a neighbor who doesn't mind looking after them. The cats are mostly outdoor types so he doesn't mind.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yeah, that does make things easier. How long did it take you to accumulate all of those cats?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Well I used to work at a rescue shelter and I loved taking home cats that no one wanted. Every month or so they will contact me to see if I'll take another and I can never say no.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That is great of you to do. It seems like there are always so many rescue cats and not enough houses for them.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Exactly. And the problem is so many people want specific breeds that there are so many animals in need of homes.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I had my first yoga class and it was rough, but I had fun. Were you sore after your first one?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I was really sore after my first class, but you get use to it after a while. Did you enjoy it overall though?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yeah, I thought it was pretty relaxing. The environment was kind of boring. I wish I had a view like you! What is the view at your studio of? Nature?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It sits along a natural spring, so I get to watch the water flow, which is really relaxing.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: My dog got off its leash while we were walking and ran away.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh no, what kind of dog is it?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: The dog was a Dalmatian.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Has your dog ran away before?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yes, he's a bit of an escape artist.  I should have named him Houdini.  He usually comes back though, or somebody down the street finds him.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: He's a bad dog. No treats for him.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: He just likes to be free, but I guess I should probably take him to a trainer.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It might be too late. How old is your dog now?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: He's made it through about 12 years and maybe 30 or so escapes.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: What is the longest he was gone?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Longest he was gone was about a week, it was a terrible week, he really got far out, but we tracked him down.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I would hate wandering through the big city trying to find him.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Have you always lived in the country? Did you ever try living in a big city?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I just do not like the hustle and bustle of the cities. I like the quiet and calm of the countryside. I am looking for a pet. Any suggestions.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I understand that. As an introvert, the noise can really get to me, but I love the convenience of living in the city. As far as dogs are concerned, you know I'm partial to dalmatians, haha.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I can understand that. I know that they are a good breed. Are they difficult to handle. At my age I must be careful what I get into. By the way is your dog back.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Well my dog is a lot to handle. I had to get some help finding him this time, but he's back. I'm actually going to hire someone to help me mange him, so he doesn't run away again.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I just cannot handle that. Is there a smaller manegable dog that you can suggest, or should I think of a cat. Glad your dog is back.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I don't think it's every dalmatian, mine has just gotten feistier with age, ha. But cats are lovely too. I had a tabby before I got my dog 12 years ago. She was the sweetest and very low maintenance.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Then it looks like I should go for a cat. You say they are low maintenance. That suits me fine. They also wont mess up my vegetable garden. That is a great plus. Dogs often like to dig up things. Am I right on this.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Well you may want to keep the cat out of the garden, but yeah, I think a cat, especially an indoor one, would be good for you.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Really. I have to keep the cat away from my garden too. I love my garden too much to let anything mess it up. Looks like I will have to give this pet thing a second thought.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Maybe you could get a couple of garden snakes. They'll keep uninvited guests from eating away at your garden.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I am scared of snakes. I can never handle that. So bye bye to pets for now. Looks like I am inviting trouble. For me probably the safest would be a fish or a bird.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Would you want to learn to swim with me? I found a pretty good swim teacher.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That would be great, I have tried before although I have never managed to pick it up, what anime's have you been watching lately?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I've watched a little Naruto and some Avatar the Last Airbender, but I'm not sure if that counts as an anime! Do you watch anime?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I don't actually, I don't find animation as captivating as general acting. I don't have much time for television anyway because of my dance study which has taken up a lot of my time recently.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds really fun! I really enjoy swing dancing; what kind of dancing have you been doing?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: We study all dance and it's origin, however I have gained an interest for contemporary dance and it's fluidity. I have a cat named socks just like your mums was. I love cats, do you prefer cats or dogs?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Honestly, I hate cats! My mom's cat made me sneeze all the time! How is Socks doing though?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Socks is great, she has a vet appointment coming up soon but she doesn't play up at the vets. How has life been since you lost your mum?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: It's been a real struggle. My sister took Socks, which is great because I was terrified of watching her, but dividing up the estate has been a real challenge because mom didn't leave a will. Do you have a will set up in case you die?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I don't actually have a will set up, I don't probably should think about it though, who knows what could happen. At least you don't have socks for your sake LOL.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Yeah, if I had Socks, I'd have to figure out what poor person I'd give her to in the will! I've been putting off making a will, but my mother dying has really made me realize how important it is!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I can't bare to think about it to be honest although it is true how important it is, anyway I'll have to take you up on those swimming lessons as I would like go on a canoeing trip in the Amazon rainforest.

dialogue.text: My sister and I have been pretty busy lately working on the dividing estate my mom left us.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh no, I am so sorry to hear about your mom. Is anyone else helping you and your sister? Do you have a lawyer?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: we are doing it on our own right now. it's been a while. we figured we finally needed to just get it done.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Is there anything that I can you help out with? I don't know if you remember but my uncle is a lawyer. He might be able to help out.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: that would be great. can you give him my number?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah of course, I'll send it to him as soon as we're done here. Is there still a lot left or is there anything you want me to tell him so he can start preparing?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: we were young when it happened and no one did anything so we still have all of it left.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: ok no problem, I'll let him know. Don't worry he's great and he'll help you out!

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: thank you. that's a big relief knowing we won't be having to do this on our own.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yeah of course. Again I am so sorry about your mom. And is your sister taking care of the cat? I remember you telling me you're allergic.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: she is. thankfully she likes cats and has no problem taking the cat in.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Oh that's good. Hey, in the meantime you should try to relax and maybe take your mind off things. Did you see the latest season of Naruto?

dialogue.text: Hi, I'm a pizza maker who makes pencil drawings as a hobby.

dialogue.text: Sweet. I swim after school and play overwatch on pc.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: You must be fit. I, on the other hand, am kind of round.

dialogue.author: bot_1

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Florida. It is hot here and I love to go to the beach.

dialogue.text: What kind of home do you want to buy?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Hmm something big probably. I'd love to be able to host all my brothers.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: You should make pizza for your brothers if and when they come visit your new home!

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Haha that is a good go to. I can't believe they're not sick of my pizza by now. Are you renting right now?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I am renting a condo in Florida until I decide where to settle down. Buying is such a commitment, as you know since you're in the market.

dialogue.text: yeah, it's a big purchase, especially if you're still in school. Have you and your boyfriend done anything fun recently ?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: We went to the beach last weekend. The weather was beautiful! How about you? I bet you have been drawing for fun?

dialogue.text: That does sound nice. I imagine the weather in Florida is always beautiful. Yes! I am working on a portrait. It's of my father, who was the original owner of our pizza place. It's going to go in the main dining room.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That sounds like a lovely tribute to your dad! Will it fit in your car to drive over to the pizza place?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I think I'll roll it up and have it framed there. I can probably have the delivered or something. How's your family been?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Great idea. The family is doing well. Everyone is healthy and happy, so I can't complain! How are your brothers?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: They've been good. They're all living in different places, so it can be hard to keep up. We try and all get together once a year. What was that game you were telling me about? I was thinking it could be fun in my free time.

dialogue.text: How is your painting of your father coming along? Are your brothers well?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: The painting is coming along slowly.  I spoke with my oldest brother this week.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: How did that go? Is he doing well?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yes, his second child was born last week.  Do you have nieces or nephews?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That's so exciting! Was it a boy or girl? I don't have any yet, my siblings are all younger than me.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It was a boy.  My brother now has a son and a daughter.  I do not think I will have kids of my own for a long time, but I enjoy seeing my brothers kids.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: That makes a lot of sense. I hope you get to visit them soon! I can't wait to be an aunt myself.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: Yes, I think I will have to make a special trip to visit him soon.  But it is always difficult to get away.  He lives in Arizona.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Michigan to Arizona is a long way. How is your pizza business going?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: It has been going well.  I recently hired a new assistant manager and she has been great.  How is school?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I'm glad to hear that. School has a been a bit rough recently. I had two midterms last week but I'm looking forward to spring break soon.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I remember those days.  But spring break in Florida must be exciting to look forward too.  It is still cold here.

dialogue.text: My daughter has recovered from her surgery and feels much better.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: That is a blessing for sure.  I was so worried.  Do they know when she will make a full recovery?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: They're giving it a week until she's able to come home! It's long overdue, so much weight is lifted

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: I met some clients at he pet hotel I work at that have some friendly animals that need a good home.  Maybe you could get her a small one to help the mental stress.

dialogue.text: I would recommend the simple dog or cat but they do have lizards and birds as well.  What do you think she is going to want?

dialogue.text: Awesome!  Oh, and I recently died my hair purple. Have you made any crazy fashion choices lately?

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: I just can't wait to have her home. Mine is pink!

dialogue.text: Wow looks like we are both living on the edge.  Well now we have to go Vegas before going back to our natural color. It will be wild.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Vegas is in the plans, hotel in the center of the strip, easy choice. We can walk everywhere, and if my daughter is better completely, I'd love to have her see new cities.

dialogue.text: That would be the most amazing gift.  It sounds like things are finally getting better now.  I can not wait for the days ahead!

dialogue.text: How has your daughter's recovery from surgery been going?

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: My daughter never had any surgery, I see your daughter had one, how is she ?

dialogue.text: You're right, I'm sorry - I misremembered. How is your sister doing with her MS? My daughter is recovering well, thank you for asking.

dialogue.text: No problem, my sister is hanging in there , some days are okay and some days is not all there, just taking it one day at a time. So you like working as a nurse ?

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.text: Oh I see, my hat's off for you . It takes a lot to care for someone who is not related to you. Yes my sister have a good support system , it's just that we are very disappointed on her been cut off from disability, it is hard on us.

dialogue.author: bot_0

dialogue.text: No way, the doctor was not in on it. Her employer said she is only qualified to get 3 months of disability and they cut it off as soon as she the 3 months elapsed.

dialogue.author: bot_0
dialogue.text: Oh darn, that doesn't sound right! Well I'm sorry to hear that, I'm sure it has a difficult impact on her life. Maybe a second opinion might help, if your sister really feels she is not able to work. I hope she's able to find the support she needs.

dialogue.author: bot_1
dialogue.text: oh thanks for the understanding. We are seriously looking for help and hopefully we'll find her one. She has been through a lot and we refuse to let anything get in her way of recovery. dialogue.author: bot_0
